p:
The bifunctionality of oxygen electrocatalysts were assessed by the voltage difference (∆ E) between E 1/2 for ORR and the E
j=10 for OER, in which the smaller ∆ E indicates the limited electrochemical polarization and higher bifunctional activity. Remarkably, the Co/CoFe@NC affords the lowest ∆ E of 0.70 V among various Co/CoFe
x -based samples and noble-metal catalysts (Fig. 5e). Figure 5f summarizes the bifunctional electrocatalytic activity of as-prepared Co/CoFe@NC with those of recently reported composite catalysts based on transition metals (note detailed information in Table S1), corroborating an extraordinary reversible oxygen catalytic performance of Co/CoFe@NC.
